Community Service Society of New York
MacRae, Wendell, 1896-1980
Community Service Society of New York
Collector
Prescription
circa 1934 1934 date on prescription 1934 photographs reformatted digital preservation
still image Annotation on back: Even to educated people most prescriptions might just as well be written in cuneiform. Hurried instructions of overworked doctors in crowded clinics require patient explanation and translation into "common sense language" if they are to be followed successfully. AICP's Nursing Service does follow-up work to make charity medicine worth while. Last year 4,441 families benefited by AICP's continuous nursing service. Description: Stamped on the back of the photo: Wenden MacRae 5040 Tibbett Avenue New York City Attached to the back of the photo: Even to educated people most prescriptions might just as well be written in cuneiform. Hurried instructions of overworked doctors in crowded clinics require patient explanation and translation into "common sense language" if they are to be followed successfully. AICP's Nursing Service does follow-up work to make charity medicine worth while. Last year 4,441 families benefited by AICP's continuous nursing service. Item no. 0865 Photograph no. MP-31
